action.action-desc: Mr. Jackson of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of the Air Force to operate a Technical Training Center of Excellence, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advancing Innovation and Maintenance through Headquarters for Instruction, Growth, and High-tech training Act or the AIM HIGH Act.

section.header: Air Force Technical Training Center of Excellence
section.text: Chapter 903 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Air Force Technical Training Center of Excellence

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Air Force shall operate a Technical Training Center of Excellence. The head of the Center shall be the designee of the Commander of the Airmen Development Command.
The purposes of the Center shall be toâ€”

paragraph.text: facilitate collaboration among all Air Force technical training installations;
serve as a premier training location for all maintainers throughout the military departments;
publish a set of responsibilities aimed at driving excellence, innovation, and leadership across all technical training specialties;
advocate for innovative improvements in curriculum, facilities, and medial;
foster outreach with industry and academia;
identify and promulgate best practices, standards, and benchmarks;
create a hub of excellence for the latest advancements in aviation technology and training methodologies; and
carry out such other responsibilities as the Secretary determines appropriate.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall select a location for the Center that is an Air Force installation that provides technical training and maintenance proficiency.
